task.summary: Default task
We need to bind the function in the constructor of IndecisionApp to be able to call it from its child AddOptions
We get the option written in the input wwith name option up to IndecisionApp and handleAddOption logs it to the console. Objective: learn how to pass data from a child to a parent.
We need to use setState as a function which returns the state modified
It is interesting if we write console.log into setState it is undefined even if we have checked before the setState that the error is well put into the state.
convert statefull to stateless functional components
Using defaultProp for Header ;=)
We can render conditionally subtitle
We can give a default options array using defaultProps in IndecisionApp class
e have an empty options array as defaultProp
We are using defaaultProps to put a default counter of 0
We can shorten setState with arrow function expressions
We have shorten handleAddOption
Shortening hndleAddOption setState
We see the console log which informs us that handleDeleteOption is being fired each time we click on delete each Option
We can delete each option ;=) ;=)
We can persist using localStorage and lifeCycle methods componentDidMount and componentDidUpdate ;=) our options array !
We check if value given is null when we parse it as JSON. Also we treat the case where the JSON is invali with try/catch
We only clear th input field if there was no error
We give a message when there are no more options left
We persist the count in localStorage

UninstaLLING BABEL-CLI and live-server as global dependencies. We install them as local dependencies ;=) ;=) The reason is that we want to show them on package.json to be able to run this app when we download it from git.
We use package.json scripts to exeute live--server as nom run serve and babel as npm run build
We have configured webpack
Using named exports
We are using both named and default exports
We can inline the exports
We can omit to declare a new const
We can export both inline with export default = function, and in a separated line with name as default inside {}
We can import using webpack modules from third-party libraries
We have download babel core and loader to execute it using webpack. The bjectibve is to parse jsx into es6 and es6 into es5 js when we exeute npm run build scri``t
We can split our app importing and exporting
It is better to use a default export when we have only a class
refactor extract
refactor extract
refactor extract
We need to export as default each componnent preserving its const Name = function. The Name is mandatory because of React dev tools take the Component's name from the const declared ;=)
We have extracted out all components and we show them using App
It is better to bootstrap the app directly ;=)
We can configure webpack to use source maps which makes it easier to debug
We have found that it is spelled contentBase into the webpack-dev-server docs: We have configured a faster server used as: localhost:8080

The webpack dev server loads the bundle file from memory, so it is faster. We can then delete the bundle.js being generate in our projet. The fact is that we can also generate it using npm run build, I mean, using webpack to create a huge bundle, which in the end would be needed to let it being server to the public
We have added the transform-class-properties babel plugin to use the lastest js feature to write shorther class properties
We can replace constructor properties with inline ones
If we had to store the function using the old syntax and then execute it it would fail because of this binding has been broken
To fix the issue with the new syntax we need to create an arrow function
Fixed, arrow functions always use the this of the context being provided so they do not break the this anymore =)

MESSAGE.value: We use package.json scripts to exeute live--server as nom run serve and babel as npm run build
We have configured webpack
Using named exports
We are using both named and default exports
We can inline the exports
We can omit to declare a new const
We can export both inline with export default = function, and in a separated line with name as default inside {}
We can import using webpack modules from third-party libraries
We have download babel core and loader to execute it using webpack. The bjectibve is to parse jsx into es6 and es6 into es5 js when we exeute npm run build scri``t
We can split our app importing and exporting
It is better to use a default export when we have only a class
refactor extract
We need to export as default each componnent preserving its const Name = function. The Name is mandatory because of React dev tools take the Component's name from the const declared ;=)
We have extracted out all components and we show them using App
It is better to bootstrap the app directly ;=)
We can configure webpack to use source maps which makes it easier to debug
We have found that it is spelled contentBase into the webpack-dev-server docs: We have configured a faster server used as: localhost:8080

The webpack dev server loads the bundle file from memory, so it is faster. We can then delete the bundle.js being generate in our projet. The fact is that we can also generate it using npm run build, I mean, using webpack to create a huge bundle, which in the end would be needed to let it being server to the public
We have added the transform-class-properties babel plugin to use the lastest js feature to write shorther class properties
We can replace constructor properties with inline ones
If we had to store the function using the old syntax and then execute it it would fail because of this binding has been broken
To fix the issue with the new syntax we need to create an arrow function
Fixed, arrow functions always use the this of the context being provided so they do not break the this anymore =)

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Fixed, arrow functions always use the this of the context being provided so they do not break the this anymore =)
